content.description: Start with the prominent crack that gives way to an open book/arete. Use the arete to gain better holds up and to the right. Crux is right at the top.
content.protection: Five bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: On the near cliff band (part of the N cluster of climbs). To the immediate left of Too Many Puppies (5.11a).

content.description: Mini-route up an angled slab. Put your smearing shoes on and trust your feet. Crux is getting off the ground.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band. Angled slab to the right of Graffiti Madness (5.8).

content.description: Short route with a bouldery start (crux). Awkward underclings followed by crimpers followed by more (but easier) underclings.
content.protection: Three bolts to 2 anchor bolts.
content.location: On the far cliff band. Route immediately to the right of Professor's Nutbutter's House of Treats (5.11a) and just left of a prominent arete.

content.description: Follow the obvious thin seam. Dubious feet and sharp crimpers characterize this short and techy route.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt (sling) anchor. The 3rd bolt can be a tricky clip.
content.location: On the far cliff band. To the immediate right of Flying Cockamouse and left of Blue-Collar Tweakers.

climbs.name: TreeBeard's Beard
climbs.fa: Drew Allred, Nathan Marsh, Joshua Kitchen

content.description: Difficult, bouldery roof start. The rest of the route is fun, balancy, crimpy low 5.10 climbing. The crux is getting the first clip...that's the only reason I rated it a pg-13. If you have a stick clip, it's not pg-13. A fall before the first clip could result in a twisted ankle. 3rd clip to anchor is run-out but fairly easy 5.9ish climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchor. A sling is needed for the anchor.
content.location: It's off on it's own... a ways south (maybe 50 yards)of M&M squared/ Mr. Krinkle on the cliff band nearest the parking lot. There is a new top-rope-only route which Joshua Kitchen is working on just south of it.

content.description: Thin crimpy holds (the crux) give way to an easier midsection. Gain the top through awkward side pulls.
content.protection: Five bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Line goes up the middle of two large stacked blocks of rock directly opposite the largest cottonwood tree in the area (part of the N cluster of climbs on the near cliff band). The route is sandwiched between Wait for It (5.10b) on the left and Kalamazoo (5.10d) on the right.

content.description: Corner crack in an open book easily protected with cams. Watch out for loose flakes on the face (avoid this climb if you hate loose flakes). Exit to the left of the capping roof.
content.protection: No bolts. Traditional protection. Set up your own trad anchors at the top.
content.location: On the far cliff band. Conspicuous crack between Jump Start (5.10b) and Professor's Nutbutter's House of Treats (5.11a).

content.description: Mini-route featuring big holds and a large vertical flake.
content.protection: Two bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band. Left of Quick Sand (5.7).

content.description:
Follows a thinnish crack in a prominent corner. Short trad route good for practicing nut placements.

(This is but one example of several such short and easy cracks all over the area.)
content.protection:
No bolts, all trad. Build your own trad anchor after topping out.

(Beware of loose pebbles and rocks when going up and over the edge of the cliff).
content.location: On the far cliff band. To the immediate left of Flying Cockamouse.

content.description:
Goes up the middle of the face on the large boulder.

Start in the shallow scoop and end with a few final moves on the face to reach the top.

Note: these days the 1st bolt is significantly higher up from the ground since the December '10 flooding of the river scoured the bottom of the climb.
content.protection: Two bolts to two anchor bolts.
content.location:
A short mini-route (or it can be a highball boulder problem) on a large and conspicuous leaning boulder near the largest cottonwood tree in the area.

This climb is close to the N cluster of climbs on the near cliff band.

content.description: Fun face climb at a friendly angle.
content.protection: Four bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Part of the S cluster of climbs on the near cliff band. The 1st bolted line in the S cluster from the left (when facing the cliff). To the immediate left of Clay Pigeons (5.10a).

content.description:
Follows a prominent arete.

After the mini-roof a few side pulls and a key crimper get you to the uber (sink-the-pink) pocket hold up and to the right.
content.protection: Two bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band. Immediately left of The Pineapple Incident (5.10b)

content.description: Follows a line directly left of a prominent arete. Crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolts. Finish through the flat block of rock capping the top.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This climb is located on the near cliff band (part of the N cluster of climbs). It is to the right and around the corner from Kalamazoo (5.10d).

content.description:
Mantle onto a large blocky protrusion. From atop the block use thin tiny edges and the arete to get to the top.

Not too hard as long as you can trust your feet on the tiny edges. If not, all bets are off.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolts top anchor
content.location: One of the climbs on the far south side of Shotgun Alley.

content.description: Crack flanked by numerous large face holds.
content.protection: Trad gear in the crack. Two anchor bolts at the top.
content.location: On the near cliff band. Crack that splits the face to the right of Ignoramus. Part of the N cluster of climbs.

content.description: Mini-route with good holds and interesting features. You'll find that the tricky start really complements the rest of the climb.
content.protection: Two bolts to a 2 bolt anchor and chains.
content.location: On the near cliff band. The route to the left of Fancy Pants (5.10d) and right of Ten-legged Interspecies Cha-cha (5.7).

content.description: Start requires good balance followed by the crimpy crux. Finish with side pulls through the large block capping the climb.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Located on the far cliff band. Bolted line to the right of Tommy the Cat (5.7).

content.description: On south side of canyon @ tukumpetsi river trail. Near end of canyon. West facing face obvious splitter starts about 10' up 2 cracks side by side
content.location: 2bolt anchor with webbing

content.description: easy start, leads to no hands followed by no feet. The true start is on small rock to the right of the bush. this starts you on the/to the right of the arete and goes up over the small roof. There is an easier start if you choose to start to the left of the bush on the face of the route. Crux is between 2nd and 3rd bolt.  Find any type of foot and reach big. This is another typical shotgun style route. need to jump on it one time, but nothing to write home about or keep coming back for
content.protection: three bolts to two anchors uptop. bring sling to extend anchors. you can top rope this route.
content.location: This route is down river by the group of newer routes.  This area is still under development and the trail is not fully developed. Easiest way to get there is to walk straight up from the parking area until you hit the cliff.  there is a easy scramble down to cliff face. turn left and start walking down trail. This is just past tree beards beard and a red sun rises.

content.description: Balancy start leads to an undercling. Then over the mini-roof to easier holds up higher.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band. To the immediate left of Flaptastic (5.10c) and to the right of Sink the Pink (5.11c).

climbs.name: Nasty, Brutish and Short
climbs.fa: M. vanderMerwe, J. Woerner & M. Hansen

content.description:
Mantle onto the thin ledge then find the right combination of crimpers to move up higher towards the edge of the arete. A second mantle onto the arete gives way to an easy scramble to the top anchors.

Only the 1st half of the route is a challenge, but it packs a punch.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: All the way to the south end of the near cliff band there is final steep wall before the cliff peters out. This is one of two routes on that wall (the left one).

content.description: Start with the crack and aim for the ledge. Leaving the ledge for the crimpers above is the crux. Keep left of the arete and up past the 3rd bolt where the climbing eases off for a comfortable clip into the anchors.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff. To the right of Fancy Pants.

content.description: This route packs a lot of punch for its length. The crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolts where a good sense of balance will come in handy. Finish with a burly mantle to clip the 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Part of the S cluster of climbs on the near cliff band. The 4th bolted line from the left when facing the climbs. Unlike most other climbs at the crag the top anchors on this one are not easily reached from the top (putting up a top rope will require someone to lead it first).

content.description: Super easy bottom leads to harder moves about two thirds of the way up.
content.protection:
3 bolts to 2 anchor bolts at the top.

A lead fall on this route can be dangerous due to the possibility of hitting the rocky outcrop just to the left of the route. Aim right when falling!
content.location: Part of the S cluster of climbs on the near cliff band.  The route furthest to the right of the S cluster of climbs (when facing the cliff).

content.description: Mini-route with cool edging and balancing moves. Crux is about halfway up the route.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 anchor bolts.
content.location: On the near cliff band (part of the N cluster of climbs). Between Awesome (5.9) on the left and Wait For It (5.10b) on the right (when facing the cliff).

content.description: Follows a thin upwards slanting (towards the right) seam to a bomber hold. From the good hold it is straight up while avoiding anything in the broken corner on your right.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: All the way to the south end of the near cliff band there is final steep wall before the cliff peters out. This is one of two routes on that wall (the right one).

climbs.name: Land Before Spine
climbs.fa: Keric L and Anna J, June 2019

content.description:
Not sure if this is an FA or not, but thought I'd add it. If it isn't, let me know and I'll edit or delete accordingly.

Follows a narrower crack set in a corner to the right of a much wider off-width. Good feet for stemming, and top out is on a solid flake with an airy mantle.
content.protection: A few mid-sized stoppers and/or smaller cams (.5's, .75's) will lace this up better than sneakers. We set up an extended belay-from-above with the neighboring route's bolted anchors. Can redirect/stabilize the rope with a mid-sized stopper at top of the route proper.
content.location:
Got stuck following the patchy trails and dead ended surrounded by acacia and prickly plants. From the southern end of the near cliff band go north along the cliffs following deceptive patchy trails till you dead end surrounded by acacias at the cliffside.

Route has large obvious off-width to the left. Further to the left is a bolted arete and class 4/5.easy climb out to the cliff top.

content.description: From the top of the block of rock at the base follow the bolts up the lower face, past the ledge, and gain the upper face above the ledge. Work your way up to an obvious finger pocket followed by a good hand rail up and to the right. A hand rail traverse will make it possible to reach for the arete, which, together with some delicate footwork, should get you up and to the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band (part of the N cluster of climbs). Start from the top of a large flat block of rock on the ground (see photo). When facing the cliff this is the route to the immediate right of Too Many Puppies (5.11a)

content.description:
Crux at the bottom leads to a more friendly angle and easier moves.

Do not stray from the bolt line as there is at least one loose large block on the easier terrain to the right of the route (that could end up on your belayer's head).
content.protection: Three bolts to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Line immediately right of a prominent arete on the far cliff band.

content.description: Fun short route.  Crux could be either from the second to third bolt placement as there are only small dimer holds or getting in and up the roof if you struggle with power. Fun route but gets super hot in the sun so climb at night or in the morning.
content.protection: Two bolts/anchors up top. Run a sling off of for a smooth top rope for now.  Unfinished route and only one bolt on the route.  Do not lead at this point.
content.location: located next to silly putty.  From the parking lot follow the trail to the wall that has silly putty on it.  The trail leads to three sets of anchors on the top.  Ignoramus is the middle set of anchors. you can rap down or walk around following the trail.

content.description: Mini-route up an arete at a graffiti-marred rock face.
content.protection: Two bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff face. About 40ft to the right of My Left Foot and about 15 feet left of Vomit Free Since Ninety Three.

climbs.name: Ghost Goop
climbs.fa: Nathan Marsh, D Allred, J. Kitchen

content.description: Starts out on crimpy shotgun style climbing in the high 5.10 - low 5.11 range.  then hits a roof with a strong dyno move and some balance technique to get that 4th clip.  Crux is pulling the roof or clipping the 4th.  The route(4th bolt placement) is designed to take you left on the face and away from the arete, climbing it this way puts it in the 11+/12- range. There is an alternative staying on the arete with good holds around the right side of the arete.  Much easier(11 b/c) but still fun. great route anyway you try it.
content.protection: 4 bolts to two bolts up top for anchors. Bring some slings for the anchor over the edge
content.location: Just to the right of Too many puppies and Kalamazo0

content.description: Starts off with an easy crack but soon enters more difficult territory on crimpers. Requires good balance and delicate foot work.
content.protection: Four bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: In a sandy area on the near cliff band when walking a little ways towards the left of the N cluster of climbs (when facing the climbs). To the right of Quick Sand and left of My Left Foot.

content.description: Mini-route (or highball boulder problem) starting on crimpers and aiming for the prominent pocket three quarters of the way up. From the pocket a committing but satisfying dyno to a good hold finishes off the climb (by using a small crimper higher up it is also possible to do the dyno move statically).
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the far cliff band. The bolted line to the right of Suit Up (5.6). Directly left of True Story (5.11d).

content.description: Lay back on the side pull, steady those feet, and pray for that extra inch or two of reach. The grade is height-dependent.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the near cliff band. To the immediate right of The Pineapple Incident (5.10b)

content.description: Your first goal is the large sinker hole down and to the right of the first bolt, then up to the top using holds on the face and arete.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Far south end of the near cliff band.

content.description: Follows the arete directly to the right of Southbound Pachyderm.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Part of the S cluster of climbs on the near cliff band. Immediate to the right of Southbound Pachyderm (5.8).

content.description: Hard bottom and gets easier as you go up.
content.protection: Trad gear in the crack. Two anchor bolts at the top.
content.location: One of a few routes at the far south end of the near cliff band.

content.description: Face climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Part of the S cluster of climbs on the near cliff band. Between Clay Pigeons on the left and Mr. Krinkle on the right (when facing the climbs).

content.description: Follows the arete. Crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolts.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: On the far cliff band. The prominent arete to the right of True Story.

content.description: Fun dihedral to practice your lay away skills.
content.protection: Trad gear in crack. Build your own trad anchors at the top.
content.location: One of a few routes at the far south end of the near cliff band.

content.description: Mini-route that follows a line just to the right of a prominent arete.
content.protection: 2 bolts to 2 anchor bolts
content.location: On the near cliff band (part of the N cluster of climbs). Immediately left of Legendary (5.10b).

climbs.name: A Red Sun Rises
climbs.fa: Josh Kitchen,  N Marsh, D allred

content.description: This is a fun route spotted and bolted by Josh.  There are two starts to this route.  You can start to the left and run up t0 the 2nd bolt(you can lean over and clip the first if you want, but its reachy and easier to just clip the 2nd). doing this keeps the route at 10a.  The other option is to start directly over the first bolt under the roof. Start out on the big pocket above the roof.  this makes this route substantially more difficult and puts the route in the upper 10 range.  While this way is very fun, it is also brutal on your hands and can leave your hands bloody. The rest of this route is fun as you climb to the top to a surprise cruxxy finish reaching for the top. please don't cheat around the arete to avoid this move.  the rock quality is very poor and you have a chance to knock rocks on your belayer and people below.
content.protection: 4 bolts to two anchors up top.  Bring a sling to extend the anchors. this route can be top ropped.
content.location: this route is in between Tree-beards beard and premature gratification. at the base of the climb there appears(amongst the other wonderful gifts of trash from our friendly local rednecks)  to be the remains of a skeleton from a horse.(yes i just wrote that).
